description.narrative: The Project is expected to have a high development impact as it will (i) further enhance Egypt's power system reliability by adding ca. 1120 GWh of generation capacity per annum; (ii) diversify the country's fuel mix and generate renewable energy capacity; and (iii) reduce Green House Gas ("GHG") emissions and displace ca. 1.2 million tons of carbon dioxide per annum, a key contributor to Egypt's Paris Agreement commitments.

The project consists of the construction, operation and maintenance of a 250 MW wind farm in Egypt's Gulf of Suez area (the Project). The Project will be an Independent Power Producer, generating an average of 1120 GWh annually for sale to the Egyptian Electricity Transmission Company (EETC) under a 20-year Power Purchase Agreement. Turbine supplier Senvion will be the Engineering, Procurement and Construction and the equipment Operations and Maintenance contractor. Construction is expected to begin in March 2019 and operations two years later.

participating-org.narrative: LEKELA EGYPT WIND POWER BOO S.A.E

name.narrative: The Project is located in the Gulf of Suez area of Egypt approximately 30km North-West of Ras Ghareb on the Red Sea. The site is largely uncultivated and uninhabited. Land is owned by the New and Renewable Energy Authority (NREA) who will sign with the Project Company an Usufruct Agreement.
